overview: The Real-Time Search Query Optimization System leverages various AWS services to enhance search query performance and user experience. The architecture is designed to process user queries, identify trends, and store relevant data while ensuring security and compliance.

components.name: End Users
components.description: Individuals who search for articles on the search page.
security_considerations: User authentication is required to access the search page.
components.data_handling: User search queries are processed and logged.

components.name: Amazon OpenSearch
components.description: Service used for retrieving search results based on user queries.
security_considerations: IAM roles for access control, VPC access for security.
components.data_handling: Processes and retrieves search results from indexed data.

components.name: Amazon API Gateway
components.description: Acts as a proxy to send search queries to backend services.
security_considerations: Rate limiting, request validation, and CORS policies.
components.data_handling: Handles incoming search queries and routes them to OpenSearch.
vulnerabilities: Misconfigured endpoints leading to unauthorized access.

components.name: Amazon Kinesis Data Streams
components.description: Streams search query logs for real-time processing.
security_considerations: IAM roles for access control, data encryption in transit.
components.data_handling: Streams logs of user search queries.
vulnerabilities: Data loss during streaming if not properly configured.

components.name: Amazon Kinesis Firehose
components.description: Consolidates search query logs every 15 minutes for storage.
security_considerations: Data encryption at rest and in transit.
components.data_handling: Batches and stores search query logs.
vulnerabilities: Potential data loss if delivery fails.

components.name: AWS Lambda
components.description: Functions that compress query logs and process CSV files for further analysis.
security_considerations: IAM roles for function execution, environment variable encryption.
components.data_handling: Processes and transforms search query logs.
vulnerabilities: Code injection if not properly validated.

components.name: Amazon S3
components.description: Storage service for raw logs, Parquet files, and clustered search queries.
security_considerations: Bucket policies, IAM roles, and encryption settings.
components.data_handling: Stores raw and processed search query logs.
vulnerabilities: Publicly accessible buckets leading to data leaks.

components.name: AWS Glue
components.description: Manages data cataloging and transformation, including creating tables and running jobs for data processing.
security_considerations: IAM roles for job execution, data encryption.
components.data_handling: Catalogs and processes data for analysis.

components.name: AWS Step Functions
components.description: Orchestrates workflows for trending query identification.
security_considerations: IAM roles for state machine execution.
components.data_handling: Coordinates tasks for identifying trending queries.
vulnerabilities: State machine misconfiguration leading to unauthorized access.

components.name: Amazon Athena
components.description: Queries data stored in S3 to retrieve top queries per cluster.
security_considerations: IAM roles for query execution, data encryption.
components.data_handling: Executes SQL queries on data stored in S3.
vulnerabilities: SQL injection if queries are not properly sanitized.

components.name: Amazon Bedrock
components.description: Utilized for identifying the most relevant search queries through machine learning.
security_considerations: IAM roles for service access, data encryption.
components.data_handling: Processes data for machine learning analysis.

components.name: Amazon DynamoDB
components.description: A NoSQL database that stores trending queries for quick retrieval.
security_considerations: IAM roles for access control, encryption at rest.
components.data_handling: Stores trending queries for fast access.
vulnerabilities: Data exposure through misconfigured access permissions.

security_risks: Man-in-the-middle attacks if HTTPS is not enforced.
Unauthorized access if IAM policies are misconfigured.
